hero.headline: OpenAI Launches GPT-5.2-Codex: Most Advanced Agentic Coding Model Discovers React Zero-Days
hero.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.2-Codex, achieving 56.4% on SWE-Bench Pro—besting all other coding models. The release comes with a dramatic proof of capability: a security researcher using GPT-5.1-Codex-Max discovered CVE-2025-55182 (CVSS 10.0) in React Server Components, plus three additional previously unknown vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-55183, CVE-2025-55184, CVE-2025-67779).
hero.whyItMatters: This marks a turning point where AI coding assistants become serious security research tools. GPT-5.2-Codex features enhanced cybersecurity capabilities, context compaction for long-horizon work, and improved refactoring. With Codex usage growing 20x since August, and enterprise customers like Cisco and Duolingo onboard, we're entering the era of AI-assisted vulnerability hunting.

topStories.title: Gemini 3 Flash Hits 78% SWE-Bench in CLI—Outperforming Even Gemini 3 Pro
topStories.summary: Google launched Gemini 3 Flash in Gemini CLI v0.21.1+, achieving 78% on SWE-Bench Verified for agentic coding—surpassing both the 2.5 series and Gemini 3 Pro. The model offers Pro-grade coding at lower latency and cost, making it ideal for high-frequency development tasks.

topStories.title: Exo: Run Your Own AI Cluster at Home with Everyday Devices
topStories.summary: The exo project exploded with 1,377 stars today, enabling developers to run distributed AI inference across phones, laptops, and other devices. As frontier models get larger, distributed home clusters offer a compelling alternative to cloud costs.

topStories.title: Google Releases LangExtract: Structured Information from Text with Source Grounding
topStories.summary: Google's new Python library extracts structured information from unstructured text using LLMs, with precise source grounding and interactive visualization. The tool helps developers build reliable data extraction pipelines with citation support.

topStories.title: Context Engineering Replaces Prompt Engineering as the New AI Control Frontier
topStories.summary: The industry is shifting from clever prompt wording to designing environments where AI can think with depth and consistency. MCP's donation to the Agentic AI Foundation codifies this shift—it's now about information architecture, not wordsmithing.

trendingRepos.name: exo-explore/exo
trendingRepos.description: Run your own AI cluster at home with everyday devices. Distributed inference across phones, laptops, and desktop machines for large model deployment without cloud costs.

trendingRepos.name: rendercv/rendercv
trendingRepos.description: Typst-based CV/resume generator for academics and engineers. Create beautiful, version-controlled resumes with a modern typesetting system.

trendingRepos.name: stan-smith/FossFLOW
trendingRepos.description: Make beautiful isometric infrastructure diagrams. Generate stunning visual representations of your cloud architecture and system designs.

trendingRepos.name: google/langextract
trendingRepos.description: Python library for extracting structured information from unstructured text using LLMs with precise source grounding and interactive visualization.

trendingSkills.name: Datadog CLI
trendingSkills.description: Datadog CLI for searching logs, querying metrics, tracing requests, and managing dashboards. Full observability integration for Claude Code workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Beads
trendingSkills.description: Multi-session work tracking with dependency graphs—ideal for complex projects spanning multiple contexts. Track progress across Claude Code sessions.

trendingSkills.name: PDF Processing
trendingSkills.description: Process and extract information from PDF documents. Read, analyze, and extract data from PDFs directly in Claude Code sessions.

trendingSkills.name: Package Upgrade
trendingSkills.description: Systematic method for updating packages in monorepos with consistency between dependencies and generated code. Structured upgrade workflows.

newMcpServers.name: kafka-schema-reg-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive MCP server for Kafka Schema Registry operations with 57+ tools. Features multi-registry support, schema contexts, migration tools, and OAuth authentication.

newMcpServers.name: database-server
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive database server supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite with natural language SQL queries. Enables AI agents to interact with databases conversationally.

newMcpServers.name: openapi
newMcpServers.description: Fetch, validate, and generate code or curl commands from any OpenAPI or Swagger spec—all from a single URL. Instant API integration for Claude Code.

newMcpServers.name: dynatrace-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Interaction with Dynatrace observability platform. Bring real-time observability data directly into your development workflow for intelligent debugging.

notableHooks.name: LSP Integration Pattern
notableHooks.description: With Claude Code 2.0.74's new LSP tool, hooks can now validate code intelligence queries. Combine with PostToolUse to auto-format after go-to-definition jumps.

notableHooks.name: Permission Request Automation
notableHooks.description: Auto-approve or deny permission dialogs programmatically. Allow documentation reads while blocking production file edits—no manual clicking required.

notableHooks.name: SubagentStop Validation
notableHooks.description: Validate Task tool outputs before accepting results. Use prompt-based hooks with Haiku to check if subagent work meets quality standards.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager in Rust with async I/O. Features image previews, bulk operations, and vim-like keybindings. The modern alternative to ranger.

tuiTools.name: gum
tuiTools.description: A tool for glamorous shell scripts from Charm. Write interactive prompts, confirmations, and spinners with simple commands. Makes CLIs beautiful.

tuiTools.name: helix
tuiTools.description: A post-modern text editor built in Rust with ratatui. Modal editing, LSP support, and tree-sitter syntax highlighting out of the box.

tuiTools.name: k9s
tuiTools.description: Kubernetes CLI to manage clusters in style. Navigate pods, deployments, and services with keyboard-driven efficiency and beautiful visualizations.

highlights: LSP (Language Server Protocol) tool for go-to-definition, find references, and hover documentation

Gemini 3 Flash support with 78% SWE-Bench score—outperforming even Gemini 3 Pro
JIT context memory loading with UI synchronization for optimized context management
HTTP/SSE-based MCP server support alongside official ACP SDK
GPT-5.2-Codex with 56.4% SWE-Bench Pro—most advanced agentic coding model yet
Enhanced cybersecurity capabilities used to discover React CVEs
Agent skills feature for reusable task bundles in CLI and IDE extensions

notableQuotes.quote: A security researcher using GPT-5.1-Codex-Max discovered CVE-2025-55182, a critical remote code execution flaw with a CVSS score of 10.0, plus three additional previously unknown vulnerabilities while investigating React Server Components.
notableQuotes.author: OpenAI

notableQuotes.quote: Gemini 3 Flash achieves a SWE-bench Verified score of 78% for agentic coding, outperforming not only the 2.5 series, but also Gemini 3 Pro—making it ideal for high-frequency dev tasks.
notableQuotes.author: Google Developers Blog

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore—it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets

prompt: Daily AI news digest for December 23, 2025. Hero: GPT-5.2-Codex released as most advanced agentic coding model, achieving 56.4% SWE-Bench Pro and discovering React zero-days (CVE-2025-55182 CVSS 10.0 + 3 more). Top stories: Gemini 3 Flash hits 78% SWE-Bench in CLI, exo distributed AI cluster (1377 stars), Google's langextract, context engineering paradigm shift. Fresh trending repos: exo-explore/exo, rendercv, FossFLOW, langextract. New skills from SkillsMP: datadog-cli, beads, pdf-processing, package-upgrade. MCP servers: kafka-schema-reg-mcp, database-server, openapi, dynatrace. Notable hooks: LSP integration, permission automation, subagent validation. TUI tools: yazi, gum, helix, k9s. Tool updates: Claude Code 2.0.74 with LSP, Gemini CLI 0.22.2, Codex 0.74.0 with GPT-5.2-Codex.
